result.execSummary:
The defendant Shoua "nmi" Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shoua  Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Grode advises the Court that a plea has been reached in Case No. 15CF372.  Attorney Grode brings a motion for the Court to reconsider the State's request for an adjournment.  Attorney Grode makes a statement in support of his motion to adjourn regarding the analyst not being available.  Attorney Post states that the analyst has no bearing on her case and makes no statement.  Attorney Schmidt objects to the adjournment and makes a statement regarding the back-up analyst.  Attorney Bender concurs with Attorney Schmidt's argument.

Court denies the State's motion.
for Reconsideration of State's Request to Adjourn

Defendant Shoua  Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chai Moua, Interpreter, is sworn.  Attorney Grode recites the appearances and states that he is requesting a motion for adjournment since his analyst is not available.  Attorney Kryshak moves to dismiss based on the motion for adjournment. Attorney Schmidt moves to dismiss based on the motion for adjournment.  Attorney Post makes a statement.  Attorney Bender moves for a dismissal.  Attorney Grode makes a statement to the Court.  

Court admonishes the State.  Motion to adjourn is denied.  Court questions Attorney Grode regarding not issuing a witness list.  Court orders that the State file a witness list by no later than 4:30 today.
Checklist
Jury trial - 12 person on July 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shoua  Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court schedules dates for all cases.  Motions, jury instructions and verdict will be filed by no later than June 24, 2016.  A motion hearing will be scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.  The jury trial will be scheduled on July 19-22, 2016.  Three defendants will need interpreters.

Defendant Shoua  Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kryshak has filed a Motion to Sever.  States opposes.  Attorney Kryshak makes a statement in support of his motion.  Attorney Grode makes a statement in opposition to the motion.  

Court denies the motion.
to Sever
Cover Letter from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated Feb. 25, 2016.
cover letter from Attorney Kryshak
Scheduling conference at 02-22-2016 08:30 am
(Defendant)
Cover Letter from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated Dec. 10, 2015.

Defendant Shoua Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant See Her in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Shoua Lee in court with attorney Richard Bender.  Ge Khang in court, unrepresented.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Tou Yang, is sworn.  Detective Nate Reblin is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode.  Testifies to employment as a narcotics officer.  Testifies that on October 8, 2015 he executed a search warrant.  Testifies to the items found while executing the search warrant.  Attorneys Kryshak, Sheets and Bender stipulate to identity of their clients.  Witness identifies defendant, Ge Khang, in the courtroom.  Testifies to the items found at the residence and where it was found.  Attorney Kryshak stipulates to methamphetamine being found in a vehicle.  Cross-examination by Attorney Kryshak  Questions witness regarding who was all present at the residence.  Cross-examination by Attorney Sheets.  Questions witness regarding items found.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bender.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 12-08-2015 09:15 am

Defendant Shoua Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court is having a problem getting a hmong interpreter and is going to adjourn this matter.  An interpreter will be set up prior to the next hearing.  Court advises Ge Khang and Yia Yang to contact the public defender's office.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 11-30-2015 10:30 am
Defendant Shoua Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bound over for preliminary hearing. Bond continued.
